sub_topic: Identifying the maximum independent set in a graph.
message_1:
Consider the following undirected graph:

    A -- B
    |    |
    C -- D -- E

What is the size of the largest independent set in this graph?
message_2: An independent set in a graph is a set of vertices where no two vertices are adjacent. In this graph, the largest independent set consists of 3 vertices: A, E, and either B or C (but not both, since B and C are connected). So, the size of the largest independent set in this graph is 3.
